settings.text:
Caring for the environment is how we care for those we serve.
Less plastic, Less paper, Less toxic waste.

settings.title: Reducing Plastic and Supporting Health
settings.text:
Research has shown that plastic pollution is linked to several types of cancer, including breast, prostate, and colorectal cancers. With over 8 million tons of plastic entering our oceans each year, plastic waste has become a major environmental and public health concern. At SurvivorRx, we recognize that healthy survivorship is closely tied to a healthy planet.

That’s why we are committed to reducing our environmental footprint through sustainable packaging choices, such as our reusable dispenser that holds your daily packets. We are proud to have earned the Beaches Go Green stamp of approval for incorporating the 4 R’s: Refuse, Reduce, Reuse, and Recycle into our processes. By making these conscious decisions, we are not only helping the environment but also supporting the well-being of cancer survivors and future generations!

settings.title: Reducing Plastic Use
settings.text: We're committed to reducing plastic waste by packaging our supplements in reusable metal dispensers with bamboo tops, offering a sustainable alternative to single-use plastic.

settings.title: Packets vs. Bottles
settings.text: Instead of 8-10 plastic bottles, customers receive everything in just 2 packets. If 1,000 customers switch, we could prevent 120,000 plastic bottles from being used each year—making a big impact on reducing plastic waste.

settings.title: Conserving Trees
settings.text: Millions of trees are cut for disposable paper, with 42% of global wood harvest used for paper products. Our reusable dispensers help reduce demand for paper packaging, supporting forest conservation.

settings.title: Climate Friendly Shipping
settings.text: Our shipping carrier, Sendle, is 100% carbon-neutral — maximizing space with existing carriers to ensure efficiency, and purchasing offsets for all carbon emissions.

settings.quote: "Thank you for joining us on this journey toward a cleaner world. Your support helps us create meaningful change, one step at a time, for a healthier planet and a brighter future!"
settings.author: Dr. Joseph and Marzena Mignone

settings.description: Shop wellness products you can rely on. Our supplements were created to support you in every step of your survivorship journey.

settings.text:
References

1. American Cancer Society. (2018). Microplastics in the Environment and Human Health. Retrieved from American Cancer Society.

2. Cancer Epidemiology, Biomarkers & Prevention. (2019). Plastics and Cancer: Associations with Human Health. Retrieved from CEBP.

3. Environmental Paper Network. (2021). Paper Calculator 4.0. Retrieved from Environmental Paper Network.

4. National Geographic. (2018). Planet or Plastic? Retrieved from National Geographic.

5. World Health Organization. (2019). Microplastics in Drinking Water. Retrieved from WHO.

6. AAMC. (2024). Microplastics are inside us all. What does that mean for our health. Retrieved from Association of American Medical Colleges.
